data.description:
Eat your friends in 'SHARKS' a cross-platform (PC and VR) multiplayer hunting game. Hunt with groups of up to 10 people online. Eat whatever you can to survive and avoid the zombie sharks: last player standing wins.

The VR controls are super responsive (it feels like a human-shark mind meld): simply look where you want the shark to swim. Pull the trigger to move forward, press the grip button to chomp/eat things. 

You can also play with your non-VR friends on the flat-screen version. Each game is a quick snack-sized round so it's perfect to just drop-in or -out whenever you've got a spare minute.

Collect goldfish to customise your shark with tons of unlockable hats, eyes, teeth and extras. Who would have thought sharks could be so cute?

There's no pay-to-win so everyone is on equal terms....and if you get tired of eating each other, there are plenty of other things to chomp on (more game modes coming soon)

What are you waiting for? Get your friends to download SHARKS and start eating each other today!

Note: This is a demo version with one game mode (zombie tag) and one arena. If you like what you see so far please leave a review and include any suggestions so we can make sure your ideas make it into to the final full game. Thanks!

changelog.change_log:
Release Notes - v0.1k - "HEALTH UI"

In this release we've added onscreen health UI so you can see how much damage you are causing and how much health you receive for food.

- Health UI
- HUD always active

Fixes:
- Removed HUD toggle from settings

As we get further along we'll be looking for more feedback regarding gameplay, etc, but for now we just want to make sure everyone can get started and that the multiplayer is solid. If you have any feedback or comments, please direct them to the Discord. Cheers!

- Simon and Jamie

Release Notes - v0.1j - "HOT FIX"

Fixes:
- drop bitten object if another shark takes it
- option to invert y-axis in settings
- menu tweaks

Release Notes - v0.1i - "BITE CLUB"

In this release we've added the ability to bite and grab objects so you can move them around the environment. See if you can find the biteable diver (complete with sharkproof wetsuit)!

- Bite objects and drag them around (hold the bite button)
- The heavier the object you are biting/carrying the slower you go
- Throw bitten objects (flick your head and release the bite button)
- Cannonballs explode when they hit something
- Explosions impact nearby sharks
- Treasure Chests: complete quests to unlock rewards
- Unlock more items:  1:10 chance for 'Rare', 1:50 for 'Epic', 1:100 for 'Legendary'

Fixes:
- Changed food outline color to green
- Hazard outline color to red
- Hazards disabled for longer after you hit them

Coming Soon:

- More powerups: invincibility, friggin inlaserbility!
- More items and skins
- More game maps and modes

As we get further along we'll be looking for more feedback regarding gameplay, etc, but for now we just want to make sure everyone can get started and that the multiplayer is solid. If you have any feedback or comments, please direct them to the Discord. Cheers!

- Simon and Jamie

Release Notes - v0.1h - "PIRATE PREVIEW"

In this release we've added a pirate ship to the multiplayer arena so you have more places to explore and hide.

Coming Soon:

- More powerups: invincibility, friggin inlaserbility!
- More items and skins
- More game maps and modes

As we get further along we'll be looking for more feedback regarding gameplay, etc, but for now we just want to make sure everyone can get started and that the multiplayer is solid. If you have any feedback or comments, please direct them to the Discord. Cheers!

- Simon and Jamie

Release Notes - v0.1g - "GOLD RUSH"

In this release we've added:
- Goldfish: edible in-game currency
- Unlock random items with goldfish
- Inventory menu: customize your look
- More skins, hats, teeth, glasses, etc
- Dad Jokes from the divers in the cage
- Water surface boundary
- More blood!

Collect the goldfish in-game currency. They respawn every half-hour, so come back often to maximize your stash. 

Fixes:
- Moved camera further behind shark
- Cameras improved in tight spaces, mirrors and signs
- Shark respawns if gets outside cage
- Shark collisions close to the seabed
- Shark collider
- Shark respawn locations
- Improved scene transitions
- Offline demo mode

Coming Soon:
- More powerups: invincibility, friggin inlaserbility!
- More items and skins
- More game maps and modes

As we get further along we'll be looking for more feedback regarding gameplay, etc, but for now we just want to make sure everyone can get started and that the multiplayer is solid. If you have any feedback or comments, please direct them to the Discord. Cheers!

- Simon and Jamie

Release Notes - v0.1f - "SKIN IN THE GAME"

In this release we've added:
- Shark skins
- More hats, teeth, glasses, bling
- Visible top net for play area
- Audio hints during gameplay, e.g. "You're a normal shark, swim away!"
- Audio toggle in settings
- Menu: disable controls during menus
- Menu: shark offset and faces camera

Fixes:
- Heartbeat starting too early fix
- Right thumbstick scrolls textboxes
- HUD toggle fix
- VR: Oculus dual core CPU speed bump

Coming Soon:
- More powerups: invincibility, friggin inlaserbility!
- The shop
- More items and skins
- More game maps and modes

As we get further along we'll be looking for more feedback regarding gameplay, etc, but for now we just want to make sure everyone can get started and that the multiplayer is solid. If you have any feedback or comments, please direct them to the Discord. Cheers!

- Simon and Jamie

Release Notes - v0.1e - "INFORMATION OVERLOAD"

In this release we've added:

- Active round player list
- Stats: Round wins per player
- Audio cue for players entering and leaving
- Heartbeat sound when round almost over

Fixes:
- Bigger signs (now you can hide behind them)
- Powerups can only be collected once
- Powerups respawn fix
- Better handling of players leaving (music and round starting)

Coming Soon:
- More powerups: invincibility, friggin inlaserbility!
- The shop
- More items and skins
- More game maps and modes

As we get further along we'll be looking for more feedback regarding gameplay, etc, but for now we just want to make sure everyone can get started and that the multiplayer is solid. If you have any feedback or comments, please direct them to the Discord. Cheers!

- Simon and Jamie

Release Notes - v0.1c2 - "NOTHING TO SEE HERE"

In this release we've added:
- Powerup: Invisibility
- More items
- Online player count added

Eat the clear fish powerup to become invisible. You will still be able to see yourself (and your hat, rockets, etc), but you'll be invisible to everyone else - watch out, they can still hear you! 

Fixes:
- Multiplayer: fix for master player leaving
- Multiplayer: offline mode room set-up fixed
- Desktop: Better cursor hide/unhide management
- No internet connection notice
- Nick name update

Coming Soon:
- More powerups: invincibility, friggin inlaserbility!
- The shop
- More items and skins
- More game maps and modes

As we get further along we'll be looking for more feedback regarding gameplay, etc, but for now we just want to make sure everyone can get started and that the multiplayer is solid. If you have any feedback or comments, please direct them to the Discord. Cheers!

- Simon and Jamie

Release Notes - v0.1c1 - "NOTHING TO SEE HERE"

In this release we've added:
- Powerup: Invisibility
- More items
- Online player count added

Eat the clear fish powerup to become invisible. You will still be able to see yourself (and your hat, rockets, etc), but you'll be invisible to everyone else - watch out, they can still hear you! 

Fixes:
- Multiplayer: fix for master player leaving at the end of a round
- Multiplayer: offline mode room set-up fixed
- Desktop: Better cursor hide/unhide management

Coming Soon:
- More powerups: invincibility, friggin inlaserbility!
- The shop

- More game maps and modes

As we get further along we'll be looking for more feedback regarding gameplay, etc, but for now we just want to make sure everyone can get started and that the multiplayer is solid. If you have any feedback or comments, please direct them to the Discord. Cheers!
